div.h1: Instructions for Parents on Home Schooling

span.p: Immunization, Public Health Law 2164 has resulted in parents inquiring about home schooling. If you are intending to home school your child(ren), the Plainview-Old Bethpage Central School District requires parents to notify us via email of that intention. Pursuant to Commissioner’s Regulation 100.10 (CR 100.10), parents/guardians are required to complete an Individualized Home Instruction Plan (IHIP) and submit that plan to the District. Please note that New York State Department of Education (NYSED) refers to home schooling as “Home Instruction”.

These are the steps to take if you plan to home instruct your child. A link to CR 100.10 is provided for your reference.
1. Notify the District, via email, your intention to home instruct your child(ren). In the email, please include the name(s) and school(s) your child(ren) attend. Emails should be sent to despinosa@pobschools.org who is the Director of Pupil Personnel Services.
2. NYSED Instructions for Parents Intending to Home School

div.p: Last week the Plainview Old-Bethpage John F. Kennedy High School Executive Student Government Board demonstrated where they stand during times of struggle, shoulder to shoulder (albeit virtually) with their community.
The POB community continues to shine through this new normal, and like the fourth-grade students in Mr. Paskal’s class at Stratford Road Elementary School, many are “Moving Mountains” with kindness.
Seize the Day – three words that highlight what may be the most recognizable song from the musical “Newsies”.
Even during this era of COVID-19, our POB community shines. Rebecca Wallenstein is a fourth grader at Pasadena Elementary School.
Another year, and another amazing weekend at Hofstra's Annual Model UN Conference.

span.a: MMS/POBMS Incoming Gr.5 Parent Trans. Night
POB Athletic Booster Club Mtg @ HS

h2.button: Attention Users: Plainview-Old Bethpage Central School District Website Content Disclaimer

div.p: This website contains external links or pointers to websites and webpages created and maintained by other individuals, and/or public and private entities. The Plainview-Old Bethpage Central School District does not control or guarantee the accuracy, relevance, timeliness or completeness of the information contained on websites and webpages created and maintained by other individuals, and/or public and private entities. The posting of this information on the PlainviewOld Bethpage Central School District’s website, including the external links and/or pointers to other websites and webpages, is not intended as an endorsement by the Plainview-Old Bethpage Central School District of any views expressed on, or products or services offered by such other individuals, and/or public and private entities. The Plainview-Old Bethpage Central School District does not endorse individual vendors, products or services. Therefore, any reference herein to any vendor, product or services by trade name, trademark, or manufacturer or otherwise does not constitute or imply the endorsement, recommendation or approval of the Plainview-Old Bethpage Central School District. The Plainview-Old Bethpage Central School District does not consent to the use of its logos, school name, symbols, or web content by other individuals, and/or public and private entities. If an external link or pointer directs the user to any website, webpage, photograph or content that is objectionable, lewd, obscene, inappropriate, or extols the benefits of a commercial product, we ask the user to immediately contact the District administration at (516) 434-3001.
